really invite you to do that.

1421.75.text:
Again, you know, she's a woman
who comes from the Bronx.

1425.02.text:
Her father passed away
when she was very young.

1433.36.text:
And now she sits in
the highest court

1436.67.text:
of the nation doing
some wonderful things.

1439.87.text:
If you haven't read
her dissenting opinion

1443.37.text:
on the Michigan case regarding
diversity and the need

1446.74.text:
for diversity and inclusion,
I suggest that you read it.

1453.42.text:
But it's nice to know
that there's a woman

1456.55.text:
on the Supreme Court
who is looking

1458.82.text:
at how America is changing
and how things have

1461.99.text:
to include diversity
and not just in terms

1468.57.text:
So I wanted to make
a pitch for that.

1470.13.text:
Because I think it's
a fabulous book.

1475.07.text:
You may not think of her in
terms of a possible mentor,

1480.48.text:
but you know, this
book that she wrote,

1482.75.text: maybe a year and a half ago.

1485.52.text:
It's very different from
Sheryl Sandburg's book.

1488.42.text:
But she pretty much says, and
she opens the book up by saying,

1491.86.text: you know: I woke up one night,

1494.66.text:
dazed and confused
in a pool of blood.

1497.50.text:
Because I passed out
out of exhaustion.

1503.27.text:
And it was a turning
point for her.

1506.00.text:
Because sometimes we work
so hard that we forget

1513.21.text:
We barely go to the gym, if at
all if we even know where it is.

1516.28.text: Which, by the way, a funny joke.

1520.22.text:
I've paid my membership at the
gym here for two years now.

1527.02.text:
But Arianna Huffington
has a wonderful quote.

1529.49.text:
She says: Life is a dance
between making it happen

1538.44.text:
Because we're all focused
on making it happen.

1541.74.text:
You have to take a step
back and let life unfold

1549.75.text: Hope you take a look at it.

1558.72.text:
We have a video on
our MBDA Website.

1563.09.text: She spoke at our Med Week.

1565.13.text:
And she's truly a
powerful woman.

1568.83.text: And she has some great insights.

1573.34.text:
She said something
at our Med Week,

1577.14.text:
She said: When the
crisis happened,

1579.64.text:
a lot of businesses
hunkered down.

1583.21.text:
And they didn't want
to make any move.

1585.78.text:
And she said, for
her, that was great.

1592.19.text:
And she could see the
new opportunities.

1594.49.text:
And from a visual perspective,
that was very telling.

1597.46.text:
She's a strikingly
beautiful tall woman.

1601.23.text:
And when she went like
that and she said:

1604.64.text:
I realized it's when times of
crisis that you sometimes need

1610.47.text: I want to be that vision.

1612.04.text:
I want to look beyond
and over the crisis

1615.61.text:
and see what the
horizon has to bring.

1619.32.text:
And I'm going to
leave Maya Angelou,

1621.09.text: who for me is a wonderful,

1626.99.text:
So we're going to
leave her to the end.

1629.19.text:
Because I want to
close with her.

1631.73.text: But I wanted to pitch the books.

1637.84.text:
I have books everywhere
in my house.

1641.21.text:
And there's a book on a
daily basis that I read

1643.57.text:
in the morning just to
kind of set your mind,

1654.32.text:
We all need something to
inspire us and keep us pushing

1657.72.text: and going on a daily basis.

1659.09.text:
So thank you for
sharing that, Alejandra.

1661.03.text:
At this time, we can receive
questions from the audience.
